Class AccountDatabase

java.lang.Object
AccountDatabase
public class AccountDatabase extends Object
This class holds all account information and manipulates the accounts and the account list based on the commands called by the BankTeller class.
Author:
Nicolas Karris-Flores, Kyle Mlynarski

  • Method Details

    • open

      public boolean open(Account account)
      Parameters:
      account - An account object which will be opened if certain parameters are met.
      Returns:
      true if Account does not exist in the database, and customer is eligible for specified account type. Else returns false.

    • reopen

      public boolean reopen(Account account)
      Parameters:
      account - An account object which will be re-opened if such an account is found to exist in the database.
      Returns:
      true if account exists in the database and is in closed state. Else returns false.

    • close

      public boolean close(Account account)
      Parameters:
      account - An account object which will be closed if such an account is found to exist in the database.
      Returns:
      true if account exists and is not in closed state. Else returns false.

    • deposit

      public void deposit(Account account)
      Parameters:
      account - An account with a non-zero balance.

    • withdraw

      public boolean withdraw(Account account)
      Parameters:
      account - An account with a non-zero balance.
      Returns:
      If the balance of the argument account is less than the balance of the logically equivelent account in the database, then true. Else returns false.

    • dbIsNotEmpty

      public boolean dbIsNotEmpty()
      Returns:
      If the number of accounts in the database is non-zero, returns true. Else returns false.

    • acctExists

      public boolean acctExists(Account account)
      Parameters:
      account - An account object which will be logically compared to all elements of the database to find a match.
      Returns:
      If a logically equivelent account exists in the database, returns true. Else returns false.

    • print

      public void print()
      Prints all accounts in the database in the order which they currently exist in the database.

    • printByAccountType

      public void printByAccountType()
      Prints all accounts in the database ordered by account type.

    • printFeeAndInterest

      public void printFeeAndInterest()
      Prints all accounts in the database with interest and fees.

    • updateAccountBalances

      public void updateAccountBalances()
      Updates balance of all accounts in database to account for monthly interest payments and fees.
